item.title: How to increase text size in SMF Code Boxes
item.dc:creator: @cawagula cawagula
item.description:
@cawagula wrote:

This tut is 100% mine, and directed more towards mopar.

Alot of people seem to complain about how the text is so small in code boxes, and how the scroll bar seems to mess up a bit, and shows lines in the code box when your pc laggs, minor stuff like that. Well, here’s a small and simple tut on how to fix it.

Changing Text Size:

  1. Open up your FTP client - (I preferr SmartFTP or CuteFTP… SmartFTP is more compatable with SMF)
  2. Go to your sites FTP
  3. Go to public_html > SMF > Themes > “Your Current Theme”
  4. Downoad the style.css sheet

Open your style.css sheet and find

/* A code block - maybe even PHP ;). */ .code { color: #000000; background-color: #dddddd; font-family: "courier new", "times new roman", monospace; font-size: x-small; line-height: 1.3em; /* Put a nice border around it. */ border: 1px solid #000000; margin: 1px auto 1px auto; padding: 1px; width: 99%; /* Don't wrap its contents, and show scrollbars. */ white-space: nowrap; overflow: auto; /* Stop after about 24 lines, and just show a scrollbar. */ max-height: 24em; }

Edit this line:

font-size: x-small;

Change x-small to small (8pt), normal (10pt), and large (14pt). Use the word, not the number. I only gave you the number to describe how the text will look.

[hr]

To remove / edit the scroll bar:

  1. Open up your FTP client - (I preferr SmartFTP or CuteFTP… SmartFTP is more compatable with SMF)
  2. Go to your sites FTP
  3. Go to public_html > SMF > Themes > “Your Current Theme”
  4. Downoad the style.css sheet

Open your style.css sheet and find

/* A code block - maybe even PHP ;). */ .code { color: #000000; background-color: #dddddd; font-family: "courier new", "times new roman", monospace; font-size: x-small; line-height: 1.3em; /* Put a nice border around it. */ border: 1px solid #000000; margin: 1px auto 1px auto; padding: 1px; width: 99%; /* Don't wrap its contents, and show scrollbars. */ white-space: nowrap; overflow: auto; /* Stop after about 24 lines, and just show a scrollbar. */ max-height: 24em; }

Edit this line:

max-height: 24em;

Change it to any higher number or set it to like 10000000000000000 for it to disable it since pretty much no-one will make one that big.

[hr]

Simple, eh? I know you prob coulda figured that out on your own, but there’s others who cant. No pictures because it’s only editing a text file.

Also, edit them in the theme your using AND in the “default” folder just to keep safe. If you do it and it dosn’t show up, clear your catche and wait 10 mins or so. I used this on my SMF forums, worked like a charm.

Hope this helps!
~Cawagula~
